overview_of_class: This seminar will explore various issues (at the intersection of philosophy of mind and epistemology) regarding the nature of belief. Topics include the norm(s) of belief, the relation between belief and judgment, the varieties of belief, our responsibilities as believers and the ethics of belief, and pathologies of belief.
name: Seminar: Special Topics in Philosophy
title: WCAS PHIL 410-0-20 Seminar: Special Topics in Philosophy
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for Philosophy PhD Graduate Students

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This seminar will explore various issues (at the intersection of philosophy of mind and epistemology) regarding the nature of belief. Topics include the norm(s) of belief, the relation between belief and judgment, the varieties of belief, our responsibilities as believers and the ethics of belief, and pathologies of belief.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The student will be expected to be familiar with various debates about the nature of belief, and to be able to state and defend a view on at least one of these debates.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: One end-of-term paper (90%) and class participation (10%).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: No textbooks; a number of articles that I will specify in advance.
